intro: Hieracium canum subsp. polianthelum, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are broadly lanceolate and hairy. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early summer, producing yellow flowers that are often visited by pollinators. The subspecies is distinguished by its larger, more showy flowers compared to other members of the species.
